Package picross

Class GameView

java.lang.Object
picross.GameView
public class GameView extends Object
Since:
2021-09-15 GameView handles any visual components of the Picross implementation. It extends JFrame so that we can add components to it.
Version:
1.1
Author:
Neil Kingdom

  • Constructor Details

    • GameView

      public GameView()
      Since:
      2021-10-09 Parameterized constructor for GameView.

  • Method Details

    • refresh

      public void refresh()
      Since:
      2021-10-09 Simply calls revalidate and repaint on the calling JFrame.

    • resizeImageIcon

      public ImageIcon resizeImageIcon(Dimension newSize, BufferedImage bufImg)
      Parameters:
      newSize - New dimension for the JLabel to be scaled to
      bufImg - The buffered image of the JLabel prior to being resized This method is in charge of resizing an ImageIcon. Used for animations on the splash screen as well as a few instances where I reuse Icons.
      Since:
      2021-10-09

    • moveBkgrndFromOrigin

      public void moveBkgrndFromOrigin(JLabel comp, Vec2D dest)
      Parameters:
      comp - JLabel to be moved
      dest - A 2-Dimensional vector which represents the new location of the JLabel This method sets the new positions of the background of the splash screen.
      Since:
      2021-10-09

    • initGame

      public void initGame()
      Since:
      2021-10-09 initGame is responsible for creating all JComponents that will be added to the JFrame when the game is launched.

    • splash

      public void splash()
      Since:
      2021-10-09 Splash is in charge of creating the splash screen for the main game. It uses a separate JFrame than the main game, which uses a KeyListener to dispose itself and begin the main game.

    • endSplash

      public void endSplash(boolean perfectScore)
      Parameters:
      perfectScore - Boolean which evaluates if user obtained a perfect score or not endSplash is in charge of creating the splash screen for when the user finishes the game. It uses a separate JFrame than the main game, which uses a KeyListener to dispose itself on close.
      Since:
      2021-10-09

    • addTopHintRow

      public void addTopHintRow()
      Since:
      2021-11-12 This function adds the "hint tiles" to the top row of the game.

    • addLeftHintCol

      public void addLeftHintCol()
      Since:
      2021-11-12 This function adds the "hint tiles" to the left column of the game.

    • addCenterTiles

      public void addCenterTiles()
      Since:
      2021-11-12 This function adds the picross tiles to the center of the board
